timeline.bodyText:
❓ Oddly enough, just declaring the <feature> dependency without attributes works most of the time so I've never understood why the feature data model needed these attributes.
I've seen cases wheredependency="true" is necessary, and also cases where it doesn't help at all. There's also prerequisite="true" which I think creates a new OSGi subsystem but sometimes works when dependency="true" does not. Have you explored these subtle differences by chance and know precisely what differs between the different strategies?
timeline.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText:
I'm not sure. I didn't actually add the dependency attribute. This feature is just moved from another file.
In my experience I've not seen it make a difference either. I'm curious too if anybody can explain.
replies.author: SmithJosh

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure it does anything right now. It is just a flag. I believe they have changed behavior in later versions of Karaf to take that flag into account though. I remember seeing a commit or two related to it as I was digging through karaf commits.
